comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: I don't think those are dandelions.  They look more like some sort of aster or mum to me.  There is also some clover in there.

comment.author: 23207716@N06
comment._content:
Cassies grandma, I do believe you're correct. It looks very much like
'Orange Hawkweed' or 'Devil's Paintbrush'. And it either case it is...
Hieracium aurantiacum. Dandelions seldom have multiple flowers as these have.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  We updated the title to reflect the lack of dandelions.

comment.author: 27632962@N04
comment._content: The white flowers are ox-eye daisies (Leucanthemum)

comment.author: 54327248@N00
comment._content: My mother's family has many pictures from the 1940s & 1950s of trips to admire wildflowers in the California central valley. This reminds me very much of some of those dense vistas of green grass and orange poppies.

comment.author: 66439726@N00
comment._content: hawkweed... hmmmm    I'm not convinced.  The shot isn't very clear but I'm seeing some much broader petals encircling the narrow petals towards the center of the blossom which is not consistent with hawkweed..  Definitely not paint brush or devils brush.  First glance at this made me think of some type of wild straw flower

comment.author: 23666799@N04
comment._content: I know one flower is daisy and can also see white clover within and what we called Indian paintbrush.
